api
Interface Task<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
TaskBase, TspTask
public interface Task<T>

Models any task that can be executed on a remote machine using Divide and conquer algorithm. Every task in the Divide and Conquer tree is identified by an ID. The parent of each task is identified by a parentID. Any client wanting to run a task using the divide and conquer paradigm in the compute space should implement this interface. For example, let us consider the implementation of a Fibonacci Series Task that returns the Nth fibonacci number. In mathematical terms, the sequence F(n) : of Fibonacci numbers is defined by the recurrence relation : 

 F(n) = F(n - 1) + F(n - 2)
with seed values 
 F(0) = 0 and F(1) = 1
class FibonacciTask implementing this interface is expected to contain the following code : 
 class FibonacciTask implements Task<Integer> {
 
        public Result<?> execute() {
                if (this.getStatus() == DECOMPOSE) {
                        return this.decompose();
                }
                if (this.getStatus() == COMPOSE) {
                        return this.compose();
                }
        }
 
        private Result<Integer> decompose() {
                Result<Integer> r = new ResultImpl<Integer>();
                if (n < 2) {
                        // Base case of recursion i.e. F(0) and F(1)
                        r.setValue(n);
                } else {
                        // Dividing F(n) into F(n-1) and F(n-2)
                        List<Task<Integer>> subTasks = new Vector<Task<Integer>>();
 
                        // Creating new subtasks
                        subTasks.add(new FibonacciTask(n - 1, Task.Status.DECOMPOSE, id,
                                        this.getId()));
                        subTasks.add(new FibonacciTask(n - 2, Task.Status.DECOMPOSE, id,
                                        this.getId()));
 
                        // Adding the subtasks to a result object and returning it
                        r.setSubTasks(subTasks);
                }
                return r;
        }
 
        private Result<Integer> compose(List<?> list) {
                Result<Integer> r = null;
                List<?> values = this.getValues();
                if (values != null) {
                        int sum = 0;
                        for (Integer value : (List<Integer>) values) {
                                // Aggregating values produced by base case of recursion
                                sum += value;
                        }
                        r = new ResultImpl<Integer>();
                        r.setValue(sum);
                }
                return r;
        }
 }

Author:
Manasa Chandrasekhar, Kowshik Prakasam

Method Detail

execute

Result<?> execute()
This method models the the Divide and conquer algorithm. (1) if(getStatus() == Task.Status.DECOMPOSE) Any subclass implementing this method should divide the existing task into smaller subtasks, pack the subtasks in a Result object and return them. The returned subtasks are consumed by a Space object by queueing them again for execution on different machine in the cluster. If the base case of recursion has been reached during the process of decomposition, then the value can be returned in the Result object, instead of subtasks. (2) if(getStatus() == Task.Status.COMPOSE) This method should compose results of smaller subtasks that were earlier generated by this task during the 'Divide' phase, into a single value that can be consumed by the parent of this task in the overall recursion tree. See putValues(List) and getValues() to know how values can be passed to setup the 'Conquer' phase of execution.

Returns:
A Result object containing either subtasks that have been created during this decomposition stage, or value of a base case in the underlying recursion, or value obtained by composing results of smaller subtasks that were generated by this task in the 'Divide' phase

getStatus

Task.Status getStatus()
Returns:
Returns the status of this task

setStatus

void setStatus(Task.Status s)
Sets the status of this task. This method can be used by a Space object to switch the status of a subtask after the from DECOMPOSE (after the 'Divide' phase) into COMPOSE (to start the 'Conquer' phase).

Returns:
ID of the parent task in the recursion tree

getDecompositionSize

int getDecompositionSize()
Returns:
Number of smaller subtasks generated by this task at the end of the DECOMPOSE ('Divide') phase.

getChildIds

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getChildIds()
Returns:
Unique IDs of all child tasks generated by this task at the end of the DECOMPOSE ('Divide') phase

getShared

java.lang.Object getShared()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method in turn calls the system.Computer.getShared() method to get the shared object stored by each computer

Returns:
The copy of the shared object that is present in the computer executing the task
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - If the computer throws a remote exception while reading its shared object, then this method in turn throws the exception

setShared

void setShared(Shared<?> shared)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method in turn calls the (system.Computer.broadcast(Shared) ) to set the value of the new shared object in the compute pace if its better than the current value.

Parameters:
shared - An instance of the shared object whose value has to be set in the shared object in Space
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - If the computer throws a remote exception while writing to its shared object, then this method in turn throws the exception

setComputer

computer - Computer where the task will be executed

getValues

java.util.List<T> getValues()
